text: - Gossip is something other.

I want you guys to see it
as separate to us.
It's hucha.

The whole energetics
of the groups collapse,

and in comes
this dark snake of gossip,

which whacks everyone around,
and I'm not having it.
- Just real quick--

Becca, I wanna address this
with you.

Last night, you were kind enough
to come to me

and say, "Some of the people
in the integration group

were--did not like
the fact

that you used the word
'temper tantrum.'"

Maybe next time,
instead of coming to me
and you being their voice,

when they come to you,
you tell them,

"Go address that
with Claudia."

That would've
squashed everything.

- Oh, okay,
this is happening, cool.

What I actually said was that
I felt a visceral reaction

when you used that word,
and I wanted to talk to you

about the language
that we use, and that was

what I was trying to get at
in that conversation,

not to speak
for anybody else.

- Because I'm, like, going,
"Why would I be a subject

"of conversation
when you're supposed to respect

the sanctity
of the integration circle."
- To clarify with Christine--

she never said
anything specifically.

All she said was,
"Be careful

who you trust
and watch your back."
And to me, I appreciate that.

Don't talk about me
behind my back
'cause that is fake to me,

and I don't [bleep] with fake,
period.
I don't know what else to say.
- Everybody was saying things.

And I'm like, "I'm not
gonna argue with stupid.

I'm just gonna let it be."
[laughs]
All that drama, all the gossip
is beneath me.
- Uh, not really, no.
[laughs]

- That is not
what I came here to do.
Thank you for your time.

- I think when you put
nine people together,

and all they have to do is
to talk about their feelings,

I think drama is inevitable,
and I think that it's funny.
- I need to say--

I could not even come to
breakfast today
because I woke up like--

whatever that is
in the group field,
I can't be here for it.
That's not what I'm here for.

I feel the frustration
of feeling drained,
and you can't hide--

you can't gossip in a corner
because the universe itself

is recording
what you're saying,

and the ripples from the palm
always come back

and hit you exactly
where they needed to hit you.

To waste precious
fricking time and energy...
[deep rumbling]

- On some BS--
- What's that?

[screams]
- I'm out.
- Earthquake!
